title: Pimiento Cheese Spread
directions: Cut 8 ounces room-temperature Cheddar cheese into chunks of about 1 inch, and pulse in food processor (or use grated cheese).

Add 4 ounces room-temperature cream cheese, 4 tablespoons mayonnaise, 1 (4-ounce) jar pimientos, or one peeled and seeded roasted red pepper, 1 tablespoon prepared mustard and hot sauce to taste, if using. Blend until smooth.
Taste and adjust -- if it's a little harsh, try rounding it out with a very small amount of sweetener (such as one drop of a concentrated liquid sucralose sweetener).
Makes about 18 servings of 2 tablespoons each.

Nutritional Information: Each (2-tablespoon) serving has 1/2 gram effective carbohydrate plus 1 gram protein, and 98 calories. Calories can be reduced by using low-fat mayonnaise, but check for sugar in the mayo and adjust carbs accordingly.
ingredients: 8 ounces room-temperature Cheddar cheese (I like to use a combination of white and yellow Cheddar cheeses)
1 (4-ounce) jar pimientos, or one roasted red pepper, peeled and seeded
